comment.author: 28192603@N03
comment._content: The General Bus Company was owned by the Dowdings who also owned Eckstein Brothers Garage,later DETCO Motors, the agency for Austins and BMC's . Actually the registration number M1901of the bus on the far right was later assigned to a modern Leyland Tiger Cub bus.

comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content:
Audience comments from the Caribbean Photographic Memories session, Leeds West Indian Centre, October 2013:

The Trafalgar Square bus station and Busby Alley street market in Bridgetown, Barbados are still in the same location close together – but now modernised. They retain the same names.

comment.author: 28192603@N03
comment._content: Actually the bus station has been relocated to Fairchild Street just east of what was Trafalgar Square. Trafalgar Square has been renamed Heroes Square,Lord Nelson's statue still dominates the Square.
